# PR Summary

For scenario `dir c:\path\name*` we don't get big perf win (perhaps there is scenarios more sensetive) however before the fix  Escape() and Unescape() methods always allocate a temp buffer in heap. After the fix they use stack to get a temp buffer for paths < 256.
